intro: Amblyanthera guianensis, commonly known as the Guianese amblyanthera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other flowering plants with showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It produces a milky sap, which is a common feature among members of its family. Amblyanthera guianensis is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests.
